taskDTO Data Type

Represents a task object.

Namespace
(Default)
Properties
name data type type namespace min/max occurs description
actions actionInfoDTO element 0/unbounded The list of actions available to the caller for execution.
active boolean element 1/1 Is the task currently active? A task can become inactive when incident information changes to make the task no longer applicable. We do not delete the task in this case because work could have been done on the task.
at_id objectHandle element 0/1 The automatic task ID (for tasks created based on an "automatic task"). See the AutomaticTaskREST resource for more information.
attachments_count int element 0/1 Number of attachments on this task
auto_task_id objectHandle element 0/1 The automatic task ID (for tasks created based on an "automatic task"). See the AutomaticTaskREST resource for more information. This value is being deprecated in v27 and will be removed in v28. Applications using this property should switch to using the at_id property instead.
cat_name string element 0/1 The name of the rollup (category) to which this task was assigned. This is a readonly property.
category_id objectHandle element 0/1 The category to which this task belongs.

The FullOrgDTO (task_categories property) contains the possible category values.
closed_date dateTime element 0/1 Get the date the task was closed. This field is read only.
creator justUserDTO element 0/1 Gets a user object that describes the task creator.
custom boolean element 1/1 true for custom tasks; false for built-in tasks. Custom tasks are those which are manually created on an incident.
description string element 0/1 The description of the task.
due_date dateTime element 0/1 The task due date. null indicates that the task has no assigned due date.
frozen boolean element 1/1 true if the incident to which this task belongs is "frozen" because of a legal hold. This is a readonly property.
id int element 0/1 The task's ID. This is a readonly property.
inc_id int element 0/1 The ID of the incident to which this task belongs. This is a readonly property.
inc_name string element 0/1 The name of the incident to which this task belongs.
inc_owner_id objectHandle element 0/1 The owner of the incident to which this task belongs. This is a readonly property.
inc_training boolean element 1/1 true if the incident to which this task belongs is a training incident (simulation). This is a readonly property.
init_date dateTime element 0/1 The date this task was activated. As an incident changes, it is possible for a task to become "inactive". For example, if you originally say that 100 records were lost in Massachusetts then latter revised that number to 0, the Massachusetts notification tasks would be deactivated. You could later reactivate the task by entering numbers in for Massachusetts. They are not deleted because work may have been done on them. So the init_date (activation date) would be either the date the task was originally created, or the date it was most recently activated. This is a readonly property.
instr_text string element 0/1 The textual instructions for the task. Note that this field only applies when instructions are added by the user. This will override the default instructions for the task. In order to get the default task instructions, you use the TaskREST endpoint.
members objectHandle element 0/unbounded The list of task members. If this value is null then the task is accessible by all incident members.
name string element 0/1 The name of the task.
notes commentDTO element 0/unbounded  
notes_count int element 0/1 Number of notes on this task
owner_fname string element 0/1 The task owner's first name. This is a readonly property.
owner_id objectHandle element 0/1 The owner of the task. null if the task has no owner.
owner_lname string element 0/1 The task owner's last name. This is a readonly property.
perms taskPermsDTO element 0/1 Indicates that the current user's permissions are to various elements of the incident. For example, is the current user allowed to change the membership of the incident (stored in the change_members property of the returned object).
phase_id objectHandle element 0/1 The phase to which this task belongs.

The FullOrgDTO (phases property) contains the possible phase values.
regs (custom) element 0/1 Information about the regulators that triggered this task.
required boolean element 1/1 true if this task is required; false if it is optional. This is a readonly property.
src_name string element 0/1  
status string element 0/1 The task's status. The possible task status values are available in the constDTO (task_statuses property).

Example

<taskDTO>
  <inc_name>...</inc_name>
  <name>...</name>
  <regs>...</regs>
  <custom>...</custom>
  <inc_id>...</inc_id>
  <inc_owner_id>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </inc_owner_id>
  <due_date>...</due_date>
  <required>...</required>
  <owner_id>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </owner_id>
  <id>...</id>
  <status>...</status>
  <inc_training>...</inc_training>
  <frozen>...</frozen>
  <owner_fname>...</owner_fname>
  <owner_lname>...</owner_lname>
  <cat_name>...</cat_name>
  <description>...</description>
  <init_date>...</init_date>
  <instr_text>...</instr_text>
  <at_id>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </at_id>
  <active>...</active>
  <members>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </members>
  <perms>
    <read>...</read>
    <write>...</write>
    <comment>...</comment>
    <assign>...</assign>
    <close>...</close>
    <change_members>...</change_members>
    <attach_file>...</attach_file>
    <read_attachments>...</read_attachments>
    <delete_attachments>...</delete_attachments>
  </perms>
  <creator>
    <id>...</id>
    <fname>...</fname>
    <lname>...</lname>
    <status>...</status>
    <email>...</email>
    <phone>...</phone>
    <cell>...</cell>
    <title>...</title>
    <notes>...</notes>
    <last_login>...</last_login>
    <locked>...</locked>
    <is_external>...</is_external>
  </creator>
  <notes>
    <id>...</id>
    <parent_id>...</parent_id>
    <user_id>
      <id>...</id>
      <name>...</name>
    </user_id>
    <user_fname>...</user_fname>
    <user_lname>...</user_lname>
    <create_date>...</create_date>
    <modify_date>...</modify_date>
    <modify_user>
      <id/>
      <first_name>...</first_name>
      <last_name>...</last_name>
    </modify_user>
    <text>
      <format>...</format>
      <content>...</content>
    </text>
    <children/>
    <mentioned_users>
      <id>...</id>
      <name>...</name>
    </mentioned_users>
    <comment_perms>
      <update>...</update>
      <delete>...</delete>
    </comment_perms>
    <is_deleted>...</is_deleted>
    <actions>
      <id>...</id>
      <name>...</name>
      <enabled>...</enabled>
    </actions>
    <inc_id>...</inc_id>
    <inc_name>...</inc_name>
    <task_id>...</task_id>
    <task_name>...</task_name>
    <type>...</type>
    <inc_owner>
      <id>...</id>
      <name>...</name>
    </inc_owner>
  </notes>
  <closed_date>...</closed_date>
  <actions>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
    <enabled>...</enabled>
  </actions>
  <phase_id>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </phase_id>
  <category_id>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </category_id>
  <notes_count>...</notes_count>
  <attachments_count>...</attachments_count>
</taskDTO>
